title: Drawing, "Alternative Designs for a Chimney Piece and Adjoining Bays", ca. 1725
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash on cream laid paper
markings: Stamp: in red-brown, lower right corner, "AB" encircled:  Lugt no. 76, mark of A. Barrion.
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The left half includes a candle bracket showing a child holding two scrolls topped by sockets; a medallion with the bust of a woman under a canopy; a painting with a woman and two children one of whom is Cupid. The decoration is sparser in the right half. Bottom margin; plans of the mantelpiece.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Alternative Designs for a Chimney Piece and Adjoining Bays", ca. 1725.
ca. 1725. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash on cream laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-252.
